brief: This command deletes a global DHCPv6 parameter from the configuration database. The server uses the value specified in the configuration file, or a default value if the parameter is not specified in the configuration file, after deleting the parameter from the database.
cmd-comment: This command carries the list including exactly one name of the parameter to be deleted. The ``server-tags`` list is mandatory and must contain exactly one server tag. Specifying an empty list, a value of ``null``, or multiple server tags will result in an error.
cmd-syntax: <specification of the database to connect to>
name: remote-global-parameter6-del
